strings.Value: "I'm leaving at once. I need to free the prisoners before the goblins serve them for dinner — or worse."
"To hell with the idiots who managed to get captured by goblins. I want to crush their insolent chief who dares build a fort in my lands."
"The prisoners mentioned a shaman. The leader?"
"I have to go."
"Can this goblin camp have something to do with the seeds?"
"How are the prisoners?"
[Attack the prisoners] "I cannot risk other's lives — either my soldier or my people — by having you run free."

"We discovered the magic seeds are transported by water. If the shaman is infecting prisoners on purpose, then anyone who has consumed the water can give birth to a monster. There's no time — I have to kill them all."
"Have it your way, Kesten."

{n}Kesten nods. His armor is covered with cuts and scratches, there is blood on his gloves, but he himself is uninjured.{/n} "You are right on time, {mf|baron|baroness}. We were losing hope — no longer, now that you are here."

"Further down the path, behind a palisade lies a nest of goblins. We chanced upon it while heading up-river. I've no idea when these pests managed to build it and so fast — we scouted it less than a ten-day ago, and there was no trace of them!"
{n}Kesten regains his composure.{/n} "Whatever the cause, the surrounding area is thick with goblins — only one of the scouts we sent made it back. He reports they have raised a fort of sorts at the top of the hill, around a totem to {g|Lamashtu}Lamashtu{/g}. They packed the fort with cages — with prisoners inside."

"We've managed to rescue a few of the captives. Others escaped and came back on their own. We've questioned them — they say the shaman performs rituals on the prisoners. We entrenched ourselves here to prepare for an attack, but goblins keep coming at us — they're not giving us a moment's peace! The way they are hounding us, we cannot protect the survivors and attack the camp at the same time." {n}Kesten turns to face you, his eyes determined.{/n} "Only you can rescue the caged prisoners in the fort, Your Grace."
"I wish you good fortune, Your Grace. Send the ones you rescue our way — we'll protect them."
"You won't be able to pass the camp without a fight in any case. Save the people while searching for the chief! They are your subjects, after all!"
"The scout mentioned seeing a large white beast at the hilltop — he thought it might be a wolf. If true, the goblin king must be somewhere in the camp."
"The only way to find out is to get inside. You'll have to get past the gates and see what's going on in there."

"Some are injured, many are exhausted, and every one of them is terrified after what they've been through. All the prisoners we've spoken to say they are taken to the {g|Lamashtu}Lamashtu{/g} totem to take part in the magic rituals." {n}Kesten frowns.{/n} "What's strange is that the shaman doesn't sacrifice anyone. All he does is shriek and pray to Lamashtu, and then forces victims to drink water until they start to choke."
{n}Kesten turns pale.{/n} "How... How dare you say that?! We know how to save them! I refuse!"
"Your Grace?"
"I am grateful, Your Grace."
